intro: Ditassa venosa, commonly known as the veined ditassa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with distinct veins, and its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
